results.title: Masquerade
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The magical fingers of master animator Co Hoedeman, whose film The Sand Castle won an Oscar in 1979, has created yet another world of piquant creatures. Papier mache puppets ride machines and manipulate robots strange to the human eye. A great masquerade is in the planning, and the air crackles with excitement. Plunged into the joys and frustrations of creating costumes, the zealous puppets produce a bumper crop, each one more elaborate than the last. The film illustrates the creative process, with its inevitable pitfalls and rewards. It says that to create is to be alive.

results.title: No act of God...
results.creator_credit: Ian Ball, Sidney Goldsmith, Andy Thomson, Rupert Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The world is running low on cheap fossil fuels. To the question What else is there?” many scientists have answered, “nuclear power. But some physicists, as well as energy analysts, government consultants, and even law enforcement agencies, are alarmed by the proliferation of nuclear reactors. This film explains various experts’ concerns, among them Dr. Hannes Alfven, Nobel prize-winning physicist. He no longer supports nuclear power, and states most determinedly, “No act of God is permitted.”

results.title: Ninja scroll (D)
results.creator_credit: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Haruo Sai, Masaki Sawanobori, Shigeaki Komatsu, JVC, Movic and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: Feudal Japan - a time of danger, intrigue and deception. Jubei is a masterless ninja who travels the land alone, hiring his services to those with gold or a worthy cause. An evil conspiracy is at work to overthrow the Government. Jubei reluctantly joins forces with a mysterious old man and the beautiful but tragic Kagero, in an effort to defeat the Shogun of the dark and his demonic cronies. Not surprisingly this is a struggle that involves huge amounts of action, violence, bloodletting, sex, supernatural powers and transmogrification. The animation is an impressive though slightly incongruous blend of detailed architecture, evocative landscape and highly stylized action figures. It will also interest followers of popular culture. Citizens Award Winner, 1993 Yubari City International Adventure Fantastic Film Festival. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS ANIMATED FILM HAS AN ‘R’ RATING FOR PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF 18 DUE TO THE EXPLICIT VIOLENT AND SEXUAL NATURE OF ITS CONTENT.

results.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
results.creator_credit: Michael Radford, Simon Perry, Rosenblum Productions, Umbrella Entertainment and Virgin
results.brief_description: A bleak view of a totalitarian future that is visually faithful to the famous novel by George Orwell. John Hurt stars as Winston Smith, the man who revolts against “The Party’s” rules on correct actions, words, gestures and thoughts. Also stars Richard Burton in his last screen role, Suzanna Hamilton, Cyril Cusack and Gregor Fisher. Music score is by Eurythmics and Dominic Muldowney.

results.title: Just an idea
results.creator_credit: Guy Blanchard, James Mellor, Central Office of Information and Editorial Film Productions
results.brief_description: The many sources of technical information available to British industry, including research associations, technical libraries, and the constituent organisations of the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research. The film illustrates how the owner of an engineering firm solves a production problem with the help of valuable technical information obtained from these sources.

results.title: Just a short story
results.creator_credit: Bevon Peddell, Keith Salvat and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: This is a true story based on the Australia’s Stolen Generation. It is an animated account of the disintegration of an Aboriginal family on Menindee Mission in 1947. The story is told and narrated by Aunty Beryl Carmichael.

results.title: No fear, no die = Sen fout la mort [NTSC] (D)
results.creator_credit: Claire Denis, Francis Boespflug, Philippe Carcassonne, Camera One, Cinea, La Sept, Les Films de Mindif, NEF Filmproduktion and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: This unsettling and at times disturbing film deals with the unpalatable and violent practice of illegal cockfighting in France. But director Claire Denis (Chocolat, Good work, Nenette and Boni) looks further into the motives and reasons behind those who indulge in this rather nasty past-time and in doing so has produced a film with soul and depth, exploring the complexities of human nature. The story revolves around the two main characters of Dah (Isaach de Bankole), an African immigrant and Jocelyn (Alex Descas), a West Indian, who team up in a partnership to train and supply fighting cocks for the rather unsavoury bar-owner Pierre Ardennes (Jean-Claude Brialy) whose soul aim is to make big money through holding cockfights in the basement of his saloon. Add to this fray, Toni (Solveig Dommartin), Ardennes’ mistress who becomes involved with Dah, Jocelyn’s obsession with the cocks, and money - everyone wanting more of it - and things begin to escalate. Harsh, bleak and realistic portrayal by an exceptional cast, with excellent directing by Denis, and confronting and extraordinary visuals by cinematographer Pascal Marti. NB: WARNING - Includes several graphic scenes of cockfighting and handling. In French with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: No fear, no die = Sen fout la mort [NTSC] (D)

results.title: No bugles, no drums
results.creator_credit: John Burnett, Debra Beattie-Burnett, Australian Film Commission and Seven Emus Productions
results.brief_description: The untold story of Aboriginal involvement in World War II. This program promises to be a striking reminder of the contribution made by the Aboriginal people during Australia’s darkest hours.

results.title: No big money
results.creator_credit: Doug White, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Hudon family left the city to become modern pioneers on their ranch in the Cariboo country of British Columbia The winters are harsh, the work load is heavy, money is scarce, but they live on their own land. The film presents an unvarnished look at the problems and joys they experience as a family.
